books.title: The Autobiography of Benjamin Franklin
books.author: Benjamin Franklin
books.summary: Benjamin Franklin writes about his youth, adventures, and achievements.

books.title: The Just Men of Cordova
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: The Four Just Men travel to Spain to bring justice to criminals operating in aristocratic high finance.

books.title: Twenty Years at Hull House
books.author: Jane Addams
books.summary: Jane Addams’ autobiographical account of the founding and operation of Hull House, one of America’s most famous settlement homes.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: Treasure Island
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A young boy finds adventure on the high seas as he battles bloodthirsty pirates in search of a long-lost treasure.

books.title: Psmith, Journalist
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Psmith, visiting New York with Mike on a cricket tour, finds entertainment and trouble for himself in the newspaper business, stirring up trouble with New York’s notorious gangs.

books.title: Saint Joan
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: Joan of Arc’s life story is retold, from her early life, to her campaigns, and beyond.

books.title: Fifty-One Tales
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: A series of otherworldly short stories ranging from the moral to the whimsical.

books.title: Whose Body?
books.author: Dorothy L. Sayers
books.summary: An aristocratic detective unravels the mystery of a body deposited in a bathtub in 1920s England.

books.title: Melmoth the Wanderer
books.author: Charles Robert Maturin
books.summary: A set of overlapping tales tell the story of a mysterious, malevolent, ageless stranger.

books.title: The Interesting Narrative of the Life of Olaudah Equiano
books.author: Olaudah Equiano
books.summary: An autobiography of an ex-slave in the mid 1700s.

books.title: The Footsteps at the Lock
books.author: Ronald A. Knox
books.summary: When an unsavory pair of cousins goes missing from their canoe holiday on the Thames, detectives are called in to solve the mystery.

books.title: Unspoken Sermons
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: George MacDonald presents a set of interlocking sermons designed to shape the perception and life of the Christian disciple.

books.title: Liberalism
books.author: L. T. Hobhouse
books.summary: An early twentieth century description of the philosophy of liberal socialism.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: T. S. Eliot
books.summary: A collection of T. S. Eliot’s poetry, including “The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock,” “The Waste Land,” and “The Hollow Men.”

books.title: The Devil’s Dictionary
books.author: Ambrose Bierce
books.summary: A witty, sharp collection of sardonic word definitions from the 1800s and early 1900s that provide a snapshot into the irreverent humor of early American culture.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Andre Norton
books.summary: A collection of fantasy and science fiction short fiction by Andre Norton.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Xavier de Maistre
books.summary: A collection of Xavier de Maistre’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: Three Men in a Boat
books.author: Jerome K. Jerome
books.summary: The humorous travelogue of a boating holiday down the Thames taken by three friends and their dog.
